Key Match Events: Suryakumar Yadav hit a half-century in his first match as India's permanent T20I captain.
India 213 for 7 (Suryakumar 58, Pant 49, Jaiswal 40, Pathirana 4-40) beat Sri Lanka 170 (Nissanka 79, Mendis 45, Parag 3-5, Arshdeep 2-24, Axar 2-38) by 43 runs.
Sri Lanka were 140 for 1 in a chase of 214 but then lost nine wickets for 30 runs.
Nissanka, reprieved a ball earlier by Ravi Bishnoi at deep midwicket, fell to Axar Patel to open the floodgates.
India converted that opening into a double-strike when Kusal Perera fell four balls later.
Shubman Gill and Yashasvi Jaiswal laid down a marker with a 74-run first-wicket stand.
Matheesha Pathirana got rid of Suryakumar Yadav and finished with 4 for 40.
Pathum Nissanka raised his half-century off 34 balls with an overthrow that gave him five runs.
Riyan Parag picked up Theekshana and Madushanka off successive deliveries to seal victory.
Pre-Game Insights: On match eve, Shubman Gill had acknowledged the need to improve his T20I batting template.
Post-Match Reflections: India's new T20I era under Suryakumar Yadav began on a winning note.
